items.title: Father's environmental exposure affects sperm epigenetics, study shows
items.summary: Authors of a new report believe that theirs is among the first human studies to investigate the influence of phthalate exposure on sperm epigenetics, embryo development and whether DNA methylation in sperm cells may be a path by which a father's environmental exposure influences these endpoints. DNA methylation, one mechanism of epigenetics, is a chemical tag on DNA that does not change the gene sequence but is involved in controlling gene expression.

alternate.title: Father's environmental exposure affects sperm epigenetics, study shows

items.title: Coffee and bees: New model of climate change effects
items.summary: Areas in Latin America suitable for growing coffee face predicted declines of 73-88 percent by 2050. But bee species diversity may save the day, even if many species in cool highland regions are lost as the climate warms.

alternate.title: Coffee and bees: New model of climate change effects

items.title: Researchers identify potential biomarkers of age-related macular degeneration
items.summary: Patients with any stage of age-related macular degeneration (AMD) carry signs of the disease in their blood that may be found through special laboratory tests, according to a new study.

alternate.title: Researchers identify potential biomarkers of age-related macular degeneration

items.title: Cancer drug stimulates tripolar mode of mitosis
items.summary: Taxanes inhibit cell division and make cancer cells sensitive to radiation therapy. A current study has investigated the underlying mechanisms of this action - and which biomarkers may be useful for predicting the success of therapy.

alternate.title: Cancer drug stimulates tripolar mode of mitosis

thumbnail.title: Cancer drug stimulates tripolar mode of mitosis
